Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant receiving water and light and clearly show it growing healthily.
The student can draw a plant without water and depict it wilting or drying up.
The student can draw a plant without light and show it not growing properly, possibly with pale or yellowed leaves.
The student can include some details in their drawing to highlight differences between plants with adequate resources (water and light) and those without, such as color differences or plant size.
The student can demonstrate an understanding of patterns by showing multiple drawings that collectively indicate plants need water and light to live and grow.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit some details, such as forgetting to differentiate between the plant's leaf color or size when showing differences between plants with and without light.
The student might inconsistently apply labels, sometimes forgetting to label one of the necessary elements like 'water' or 'light'.
